name: ArzelaAscoli
probTex: A family $\mathcal{F}\subset\mathcal{H}(\Omega)$ is normal if and only if the following two conditions hold:\n\[1:\text{ For each }z\in\Omega\text{, the set }\{f(z):f\in\mathcal{F}\}\text{ has compact closure in }\mathbb{C}\]\n\[2: \mathcal{F}\text{ is equicontinuous at all points in }\Omega\]
solnTex: I doubt the proof will ever end up on a test so I won't bother to write it now. If you want to see it and can't follow Conway's proof then let me know.
